  • posts

    • Biography

    I am a Ph.D. student in Department of Computer Science and Engineering at University of Connecticut. I obtained my B.S. degree from Queen Mary University of London and B.A. degree from Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications in 2016 and M.S. degree from University of Texas at Dallas in 2018.

    My research interets include Security & Privacy in Machine Learning (e.g., Gradient Attack), Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning (e.g., Differential Privacy, MPC and TEE) and Efficient Machine Learning (e.g., Weight Pruning and Quantization).

    News

    • 2021/08, FL-DISCO: Federated Generative Adversarial Network for Graph-based Molecule Drug Discovery is accepted by International Conference On Computer Aided Design (ICCAD) 2021
    • 2021/08, TAG: Transformer Attack from Gradients is accepted by Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP) 2021
    • 2021/08, A Secure and Efficient Federated Learning Framework for NLP is accepted by Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP) 2021
    • 2021/06, I started my internship in Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL)
    • 2021/02, TinyADC is accepted by Design, Automation and Test in Europe Conference and Exhibition (DATE) 2021 (Best Paper Nomination)
    • 2020/11, ESMFL is accepted by NeurIPS Workshop 2020, SpicyFL
    • 2020/08, I received the Cigan Graduate Fellowship from UConn CSE.
    • 2020/08, I joined UConn as a Ph.D. student in Department of Computer Science and Engineering.
    • 2020/08, One paper is accepted by the 33rd IEEE International System-on-chip Conference (SOCC) 2020
    • 2020/06, iPRIVATES is accepted by Briefings in Bioinformatics in 2020
